definitions.definition: simple and not complicated, so able to provide the base or starting point from which something can develop:
examples: I really need to get some basic financial advice.

definitions.definition: boring and not unusual or surprising in any way:
examples: All the music they like is so basic.

definitions.definition: what a person earns before other amounts of money, such as payments for working extra hours, are added:
examples: She earns a basic salary of £450K per annum.

definitions.definition: a common language for writing computer programs in that uses instructions that are similar to English
